author: news.com.au
title: I‚Äôm A Celebrity Tom Arnold is being paid a crazy amount
text:
HOLD onto your hats and your rage because you‚Äôre going to be fuming about how much Tom Arnold is making for moping around the South African jungle. 
Arnold, the US comedian whose appearance on the Australian reality show I‚Äôm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here has been a substantial disappointment, is reportedly earning more than $40,000 a week according to Confidential. 
The actor, who became famous for his roles on the sitcom Roseanne and the films True Lies and Nine Months, has been blasted on Twitter for seeming so darn miserable. 
America's answer to the koala üê® with the ability to sleep 22 hours a day.... #ImACelebrityAU #celebtom pic.twitter.com/mVIr1MuwHg 
‚Äî Jodie Willis (@ltlblkdress) February 2, 2017 Has #celebtom actually moved from his bed since he has been in the jungle? #ImACelebrityAU 
‚Äî kristy-lee (@17klee17) February 1, 2017 Dam #celebtom sure can whinge bout anything and everything #gohome probably a trump supporter lol #ImACelebrityAU 
‚Äî craig ticehurst (@fulmetaljacket) February 1, 2017 Cmon Australia, keep #celebtom in there & let the miserable bastard suffer. #ImACelebrityAU 
‚Äî Greg Sleigh (@GregSleigh) February 1, 2017 Confidential spoke to media analyst Steve Allen who agreed Arnold‚Äôs ludicrous paycheck wasn‚Äôt worth it for Channel Ten.
‚ÄúTom could easily be the star but clearly he seems to think it is beneath him,‚Äù he said.
‚ÄòWhy am I here?‚Äô Source: Supplied 
Despite pulling in substantial coin, Arnold told the hosts of the show he couldn‚Äôt believe it was going to air.
‚ÄúI thought it would be ‚Äòcelebs please assemble at the campsite for an hour of filming, then we can all go back to our luxury hotel and order room service‚Äô,‚Äù he told Chris Brown and Julia Morris.
And, when they pressed him on how he was enjoying the experience, he didn‚Äôt hold back.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs horrible, are you kidding me? It‚Äôs the worst thing I‚Äôve ever been through. I didn‚Äôt know it was going to be real, or I wouldn‚Äôt have signed up for it.‚Äù
A rare shot of Arnold enjoying himself. Source: Supplied 
Currently there are 12 celebrities fighting it out in the South African jungle.
The last one standing wins $100,000 for their chosen charity.
